snippet: Pfc. Bradley Manning’s lead lawyer presented witnesses and evidence to try to prove that the soldier who gave classified documents to WikiLeaks had not sought to help the enemy.
abstract: Defense lawyers for Pfc Bradley Manning ask military judge to acquit him of the most serious charges he faces--aiding the enemy by providing classified information to WikiLeaks--as they begin to present their witnesses at his court-martial.
lead_paragraph: Pfc. Bradley Manning’s lead lawyer presented witnesses and evidence to try to prove that the soldier who gave classified documents to WikiLeaks had not sought to help the enemy.

headline.main: Soldier’s Lawyers Ask Judge to Acquit on Aid to Enemy
headline.print_headline: Soldier’s Lawyers Ask Judge To Acquit on Aid to Enemy
